author: Maxon
complete_description: You're now ready to dive deeper into Cinema 4D.

steps.description: The Objects Manager The Objects Manager is the central nervous system of your project. It lists all objects and tags in your scene with hierarchical organization. Click on some objects to select them. They will be highlighted both in the Objects Manager and the Viewport.

The Attributes Manager The Attributes Manager displays settings for selected objects, tools, and more. This is where you can adjust properties like size, color, or texture. Select an object in the Objects Manager to explore and change its attributes here.

The Create Palette The Create Palette allows you to add objects like primitives, text, deformers, cameras, and lights to your scene. Hint: Long-press a button to expand an icon palette for more options.
The Tools Palette The Tools Palette offers a variety of tools to manipulate your objects. Click a tool to use it, and its attributes will appear in the Attributes Manager.
Project Tabs Cinema 4D allows you to open multiple project files, represented as tabs at the top. Switch between projects by clicking their respective tabs, or click the + to create a new project.
The Material Manager The Material Manager lists all materials in your scene. Click the Material Manager icon to open and close it. Use this to create or modify materials for your objects.

The Timeline Scroll Bar The Timeline Scroll Bar allows you to scrub through time in your scene. You can also view and adjust keyframes. Press Play to watch the scene animate or drag the scroll bar to move through time.

welcome_description: This is a quick breakdown of important parts of the Cinema 4D interface.
